User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the AnonChat application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

lastActive.description: Timestamp of the user's last activity.

isAi.description: Indicates if the user is an AI or human.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a single chat message between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChatMessage entity.

senderId.description: Reference to User who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatMessage)

receiverId.description: Reference to User who received the message. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatMessage)

content.description: The text content of the chat message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

ChatSession.title: ChatSession
ChatSession.description: Represents a chat session between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChatSession entity.

user1Id.description: Reference to the first user in the chat session. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatSession)

user2Id.description: Reference to the second user in the chat session. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatSession)

startTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the chat session started.

endTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the chat session ended.  Can be null if the chat is active.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support anonymous 1-on-1 text chat. It prioritizes authorization independence and efficient querying. 

*   `/users/{userId}`: Stores user profiles, including `lastActive` and `isAi`.  This data is private to each user, secured by path-based rules. No denormalization needed here.
*   `/chat_sessions/{chatSessionId}`: Represents chat sessions between two users. The `user1Id` and `user2Id` fields link to the respective users.  
*   `/chat_sessions/{chatSessionId}/messages/{messageId}`:  Stores individual chat messages within a specific session. This subcollection enforces that only users participating in the session (identified by `chatSessions.user1Id` or `chatSessions.user2Id`) can read or write messages, which are enforced in security rules.

**Authorization Independence:** The structure achieves authorization independence by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. User authorization is determined solely by the user's `uid` and the path structure, without relying on parent document data.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**
*   The segregation of chat messages into subcollections `/chat_sessions/{chatSessionId}/messages/{messageId}` ensures that `list` operations are always scoped to a specific chat session, preventing unauthorized access to messages from other sessions.
